title: Getting Started with Node.js
content: Node.js is a JavaScript runtime built on Chrome's V8 engine. In this blog, we will explore how to set up a simple server.

title: Understanding Express Middleware
content: Middleware functions in Express are functions that have access to the request and response objects. They are essential for tasks like authentication and logging.

title: Mastering CSS Grid
content: CSS Grid is a powerful 2D layout system for the web. Learn how to create responsive layouts with just a few lines of code.

title: Introduction to EJS Templates
content: EJS (Embedded JavaScript) is a templating language that lets you generate HTML markup with plain JavaScript. It integrates seamlessly with Express.

title: JavaScript ES6 Features
content: ES6 introduced many powerful features such as arrow functions, template literals, destructuring, and modules. This article covers the most useful ones.
